text:
Click 'good mask(n)' button or press key'N'
to annotate a GOOD MASK. Later you will
be taught to decide what is a good mask.

Click 'bad mask(m)' button or press key'M'
to annotate a BAD MASK.

Click 'back(b)' button or press key 'B'
 to undo the last decision or remove an unfinished polygon mask.

Click the 'delete' button to enable/disable
 deletion of falsely annotated masks.
 When delete is enabled, right-click on a
mask to delete it.

During the experiment, click the 'Next' button
to proceed to the next experiment step.

During the experiment your current task
 is shortly described here.

Here you will find hints which keys and
buttons to use at the current stage of the
experiment.

Original image view(RGB).

NOTE: Later you can use all 4 views to
zoom, hover and click.

Colored masks on original image view.

 Masks that have been annotated as GOOD MASK
are indicated here in different colors.

Numbers indicate the unique mask ID. During
the experiment, proposed masks will be indicated
by a green contour. When creating masks interactively
the mask will be shown in full white.

Binary masks on original image view.

Masks that have been annotated as GOOD MASK
are shown here in white color. During the experiment,
proposed masks will be indicated by a green contour.

When creating masks interactively the mask
will be shown in light blue. Overlapping
masks will be indicated in red.

NOTE: Small areas overlapping at the masks'
edges are no problem but large red areas possibly
 indicate a falsely annotated mask.

Annotation point view.

 Later when drawing polygon masks and when
annotating interactively the
annotation points will be shown here.
